metadata.title: CVE-2024-38553 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: net:fec: remove .ndo_poll_controller to avoid deadlocks There is a deadlockissue found in sungem driver, please refer to the commit ac0a230f719b("eth: sungem: remove .ndo_poll_controller to avoid deadlocks"). The rootcause of the issue is that netpoll is in atomic context and disable_irq()is called by .ndo_poll_controller interface of sungem driver, however,disable_irq() might sleep. After analyzing the implementation offec_poll_controller(), the fec driver should have the same issue. Due tothe fec driver uses NAPI for TX completions, the .ndo_poll_controller isunnecessary to be implemented in the fec driver, so fec_poll_controller()can be safely removed.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-38553` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-263-generic - 4.4.0-263.297~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-263-generic - 4.4.0-263.297~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-263-lowlatency - 4.4.0-263.297~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro with Legacy support add-on: https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1140-aws - 4.4.0-1140.146
Available with Ubuntu Pro with Legacy support add-on: https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1185-azure - 4.15.0-1185.200~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro with Legacy support add-on: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-263.297~14.04.1').
linux-aws package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1140.146').
linux-azure package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1185.200~14.04.1').
